commitResults.messageBody:
Previously all classes share the same StudentList object and several
Person share the same Class object, which resulting in several classes
or students being updated together.

Allows user not to include student when creating a new class.
Adds valid student names within limit when being fed a string of names,
and alert tutors which students are not added due to class limit or
non-existing students.

Show existing students, invalid names, and limit exceeded accordingly.
Add students until limit is met if too many students are keyed in by
user.

Implement tuition class and student Info Page
commitResults.messageBody:
- Adds ViewCommand and ViewClassCommand

- CommandResult has too many individual booleans to represent various actions to be taken by the UI, this solution is not scalable if we ever intend to add other UI Actions through commands. Let's instead change it to a single enum field to specify which UI Action.

- The Class model.tuition.Student.java actually represents a list of students, and its name is a misnomer. Let's rename it to StudentList.java.

- TuitionCard is meant to a quick overview of a Tuition Class to be displayed in a list, currently contains too much information. Let's move some of this information to the dedicated information page for users to view on demand. Information moved includes student list and remarks.

- Moved some Student details from the PersonCard on the list to a detailed Info Page, accessed by the ViewCommand.
- Removed trailing whitespace
- Accidentally removed an import statement in AddClassCommand, re-added.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add find and list class commands
Implement input history navigation and refine class info page

commitResults.messageBody: User Guide has also been updated to show command shortcuts.
Improves grammar, clarity and formatting. Updates command formats that were outdated.

AB3, which this project is built upon, uses 'persons' for their class and method names. In this project, we specialise it to students, and since the new features are coded using the word 'student' instead of 'person', it can get confusing. Let's refactor all instances of "person" into "student".
Added page breaks to facilitate pdf conversion.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update JavaFX version in FXML files
Fix UI handling of long text
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added scroll pane to main info page display
- Added text wrapping for student and tuition info cards and pages

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix student list card text and tag overflow
Update CLI History section in DG

commitResults.messageBody: Photo and roles and responsibility description for Adam are added.

This class has very similar logic to RemarkClass, except that it
handles adding a remark to a TuitionClass object instead of a Person
object representing a student.

Currently, the user is required to type "remarkclass" to write a
note for a particular class. This change needs to be reflected in the
user guide.

Future developments will work on allowing users to input an optional
remark when creating a class.

EditClassCommand should not handle the update of class remarks as that
will overlap significantly with the RemarkClassCommand's responsibility.

Minor improvement in GUI for Tuition Card: specify "capacity" and "notes"
so users know what each detail means.

Name of tuition class is now bolded and remarks of both tuition class
and students are italicised.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change remark to be an optional command format to add tuition class
commitResults.messageBody:
To handle the absence of r/ prefix, the getOptionalValue() method has
been implemented in ParserUtil.

Correct format for adding students and tuition classes has been updated.
Examples are also included.

ArgumentTokenizer #tokenize now takes in PREFIX_REMARK to recognise 'r/'
prefix in user input
Delete student command changed from deletestudent to delete.
Remarks can now be optionally input by user when creating a student.

commitResults.messageBody: The sequence diagram for RemarkCommand is updated.

The user guide contains inconsistent language and formatting as different parts of the guide were updated by different members of the team.

The entire user guide has been updated to improve consistency in language and formatting.

Main changes are:
1. Table of contents
2. Introduction segment
3. TutAssistor logo
4. Reduce wordy phrases
Add in section to explain icons
